body:
semms the top line is clipped. it seems your y axis range is just mapped to the whole contentRect, so drawing on the top edge causes clipping. I assume you have set axisMaxValue. By default, the range will slighly largher than 1, giving some space to draw the line.

I think there is no quick solution here, because you are drawing on the edge with clipping enabled, and line width is larger than 1

yes I see you have specified axisMaxValue, which will force the edge to be exactly at "100%". As I said earlier, I think there is no quick solution here, because you are drawing on the edge with clipping enabled, and line width is no less than 1
one thing could be improved is, counting the half max line width (among axis line, grid line, data set line) into account, so increase the contentRect to have enough space for lines on the edge
Now there is no way to fix right ?

I think it can be fixed as I mentioned above, but we don't have enough man power to do so right now. I want to help but a lots of things on my plate right now, so maybe later.
You are more than welcome to fix it
@danielgindi Is there gonna be a release with this fix (cocoapods version)?
Have you guys fix this? I still have this issue in `v3.0.0`

It's fixed in Aug 14. I checked the 3.0 code, it's there.
Would you be able to reproduce it with ChartsDemo?

> Yeah. I still can reproduce.
> 
> ![screen shot 2016-11-15 at 3 09 42 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6581089/20297957/e126a3d0-ab45-11e6-8339-4d1d0885ba18.png)
> 
> I changed the code in `LineChart1ViewController` a little bit.
> 
> 1. change y value to show.
> 
> ```objc
> for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++)
> {
>     double val = (i % 3 == 0) ? 160 : 200.0;
>     [values addObject:[[ChartDataEntry alloc] initWithX:i y:val]];
> }
> ```
> 
> 1. remove dash line
> 
> ```objc
> // set1.lineDashLengths = @[@5.f, @2.5f];
> // set1.highlightLineDashLengths = @[@5.f, @2.5f];
> ```
> 
> 1. change line width
> 
> ```objc
> set1.lineWidth = 5.0;
> ```

How to hide bottom info??
Is this issue resolve because i have suffer from same issue. can i get update?
Is this issue resolve because i have suffer from same issue. can i get update?

I am still having this issue and found a good enough fix.

Go to one or both of:
Charts-master/Source/Charts/Renderers/XAxisRenderer.swift
Charts-master/Source/Charts/Renderers/YAxisRenderer.swift

And comment out the line "context.clip(to: self.gridClippingRect)"

I'm not sure what unintended consequences this has, but I haven't noticed anything not working.
